intro: Micromelum timoriense, commonly known as the Timor hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to the island of Timor. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its showy, five-petaled flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 5 meters. Its leaves are ovate and have a glossy surface, while its fruits are capsule-like and contain small, round seeds. Micromelum timoriense is often found in coastal areas and is adapted to tropical climates.
